General.Name: SatixFy Communications Ltd
General.Description: Satixfy Communications Ltd. engages in the provision of vertically integrated satellite communication systems and ground terminal chips worldwide. It offers application-specific and radio frequency integrated circuit chips; modem and antenna chips, such as PRIME and BEAT antenna chips, which enable multi-beamforming and beam-hopping for satellite payloads and user terminals; and SX-4000 satellite payload chips, that enables digital on-board processing, beam- hopping, and enhanced connectivity needs, including positioning, navigation, and timing for LEO, MEO, and GEO satellite communications systems, as well as Aero/IFC systems and on the pause applications. The company also provides modem modules comprising S-IDU, a VSAT modem enabling satellite communications that is designed to provide a complete communication solution, as well as to support beam-hopping to enable the migration of satellite systems; and ESMA for fixed and mobile applications to receive from and transmit data to existing Ku-band LEO, MEO and GEO satellites. In addition, it offers Onyx IFC terminal, a satellite communications aero terminal designed for use on small to mid-size aircrafts; Aero/IFC terminal to provide online broadband connectivity via multiple satellites to simultaneously support passengers in commercial and private flights; and ground terminals for fixed and mobile broadband applications. It serves satellite operators, airlines, satellite communications systems manufacturers, and other connectivity service providers that integrate its chips and systems in their satellite communications infrastructure. The company was incorporated in 2012 and is headquartered in Rehovot, Israel.
